metadata.title: CEFR to IELTS Score Mapping
metadata.description: Mapping between CEFR levels (A1-C2) and IELTS score bands
metadata.source: Based on British Council and Cambridge Assessment guidelines
metadata.disclaimer: This is a reference mapping. Actual IELTS scores depend on individual performance in all four skills (Listening, Reading, Writing, Speaking).

mappings.ielts_description: Extremely Limited User to Very Limited User
mappings.description: Can understand and use very basic expressions

mappings.ielts_description: Very Limited User to Limited User
mappings.description: Can deal with simple, straightforward information and begin to express oneself
Can handle everyday situations and familiar topics
Can interact with native speakers and understand complex texts

mappings.ielts_description: Good User to Very Good User
mappings.description: Can use language flexibly for social, academic, and professional purposes

mappings.ielts_description: Very Good User to Expert User
mappings.description: Can understand virtually everything heard or read with ease
Specialized vocabulary, proper nouns, rare words, and technical terminology

notes: IELTS scores are averages across four skills; individual skills may vary
CEFR levels represent overall language ability, not just vocabulary knowledge
The C2+ category is a custom addition for this project to handle out-of-syllabus vocabulary
Vocabulary size estimates are approximate and vary by individual learning
